intro: Connarus lonchotus, commonly known as the long-fruited connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its fruits are elongated and contain small, hard seeds. Connarus lonchotus is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
